page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Our survey area is mostly{countryside to the{south of Yate,N.E. Avon.}There are 3 villages.{Westerleigh,}the largest,has a church,two pubs,two garages,riding stables and a local shop/post-office.With its church,old schoolhouse and riding stables,{Wapley is now very small but was once more important than nearby Yate and Chipping Sodbury.{Parkfield,}a long row of houses,used to house coal miners.The mines are now long disused as is the nearby old railway line. There are 14{farms,}one of which has a large abattoir on its land.The busy{M4 {motorway}cuts right across the bottom of our survey area but the nearest access junction is a few miles away. Country bus services go to both Bristol and Bath.
